intro: Oldenlandia tenuipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Oldenlandia tenuipes is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
